intro: Lycianthes pilifera, commonly known as the hairy bitterball, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, green fruit that turns yellow when ripe. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its common name. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
